Spoofing.description: An attacker could take over the port or socket that the server normally uses.
Spoofing.OWASP ASVS: V1.14 Verify that the application properly verifies the identity of the user.

Spoofing.description: An attacker could try one credential after another and there's nothing to slow them down (online or offline)
Spoofing.OWASP ASVS: V2.2 Verify that anti-automation controls are effective.

Spoofing.description: An attacker can anonymously connect, because we expect authentication to be done at a higher level
Spoofing.NIST 800-53: AC-14 (Permitted Actions Without Identification or Authentication)
Spoofing.OWASP ASVS: V7.1 Verify the application enforces authentication at all relevant layers.

Spoofing.description: An attacker can confuse a client because there are too many ways to identify a server
Spoofing.OWASP ASVS: V10.3 Ensure all communications are secured and have consistent identification mechanisms.

Spoofing.description: An attacker can spoof a server because identifiers aren't stored on the client and checked for consistency on re-connection (that is, there's no key persistence)
Spoofing.OWASP ASVS: V3.1 Ensure that client-side checks are also enforced server-side.

Spoofing.description: An attacker can connect to a server or peer over a link that isn't authenticated (and encrypted)
Spoofing.OWASP ASVS: V6.2 Ensure all data transmissions are authenticated and use secure protocols.

Spoofing.description: An attacker could steal credentials stored on the server and reuse them (for example, a key is stored in a world readable file)
Spoofing.OWASP ASVS: V2.3 Verify that all secrets are stored securely.

Spoofing.description: An attacker who gets a password can reuse it (Use stronger authenticators)
Spoofing.OWASP ASVS: V2.5 Verify password strength controls are in place.

Spoofing.description: An attacker can choose to use weaker or no authentication
Spoofing.OWASP ASVS: V2.1 Ensure strong authentication and session management controls.

Spoofing.description: An attacker could steal credentials stored on the client and reuse them
Spoofing.OWASP ASVS: V2.4 Ensure proper protection of stored credentials.

Spoofing.description: An attacker could go after the way credentials are updated or recovered (account recovery doesn't require disclosing the old password)
Spoofing.OWASP ASVS: V2.7 Verify all credential recovery paths are secure.

Spoofing.description: Your system ships with a default admin password, and doesn't force a change
Spoofing.OWASP ASVS: V2.4 Ensure default credentials are changed during initial setup.

Spoofing.description: You've invented a new Spoofing attack
Spoofing.OWASP ASVS: V1.11 Verify security features are defined to counter identified threats.

Spoofing.description: An attacker manipulates API calls to redirect network traffic to a malicious endpoint.
Spoofing.OWASP ASVS: V14.2 Verify that API endpoints enforce access control.

Spoofing.description: A malware uses protocol spoofing to masquerade as a legitimate application to exfiltrate data.
Spoofing.OWASP ASVS: V1.13 Verify that data at rest and in transit is encrypted.

Spoofing.description: An attacker uses VoIP spoofing to impersonate a trusted entity for social engineering attacks.
Spoofing.OWASP ASVS: V4.2 Verify that communication with trusted parties is secured.

Spoofing.description: A phishing campaign utilizes homograph attacks to trick users into visiting malicious websites.
Spoofing.OWASP ASVS: V5.1 Verify that URL validation is robust.

Spoofing.description: An attacker sends ARP responses to associate their MAC address with the IP of a critical server.
Spoofing.OWASP ASVS: V6.1 Verify network architecture limits ARP spoofing capabilities.

Spoofing.description: An attacker exploits the auto-fill functionality on web browsers to steal user credentials through spoofed fields.
Spoofing.OWASP ASVS: V3.3 Verify that the application protects against credential stuffing.

Spoofing.description: An attacker redirects DNS queries by compromising a DNS server and changing DNS records to point to malicious IPs.
Spoofing.NIST 800-53: SC-20 (Secure Name / Address Resolution Service (Authoritative Source))
Spoofing.OWASP ASVS: V10.4 Verify the integrity of DNS responses.

Spoofing.description: An attacker modifies email header information to spoof the sender's address and send phishing emails.
Spoofing.OWASP ASVS: V14.5 Ensure email headers are validated.

Spoofing.description: An attacker intercepts and modifies SSL certificates exchanged during a handshake to perform a man-in-the-middle attack.
Spoofing.OWASP ASVS: V9.3 Verify that SSL/TLS certificates are properly validated.

Spoofing.description: An attacker sets up a fake public Wi-Fi network using the SSID of a trusted network to gather credentials.
Spoofing.OWASP ASVS: V2.1 Verify that wireless networks use strong encryption and authentication protocols.
